climbs.name: Silo Crack AKA Bump It Then Pump It

content.description: Start squatting with your hands matched low in the crack, pull off the ground, and follow the crack.Note: Chris McNeil originally added this route in 2012.
content.location: It is on the side of the boulder opposite Little Agassiz Rock.

content.description: Sit start the arete with a right hand pinch and a left undercling/sidepull. The feet are tricky. Move up and left to a good crimp bar, and then continue up the arete to the jug rail. Follow that left and up to top out (see the pictures).
content.protection: Pads and a spotter are nice to keep you off the tree and rock behind you.
content.location: It is to the left of The Good Stuff.

content.description: Start low on a large jug and move up the right-facing edges/flakes until gaining a slopey pinch and topping out. The crux is moving off of the pinch.
content.location: It is located on a good-sized block on the backside of the clearing where it starts to move downhill.

content.description:
Sit start with left under cling/side pull and right hand on the arête. Move and top out. This replaces the problem The Right Arete which was a stand start.  

  A nice warm up to run a few laps on.
Silo Boulder is a tall, cylinder-looking boulder on the northern side of the Little Agassiz boulderfield.
